title: Bug 6322 - All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: When using JDK 1.4, the 'All types' dialog displays obfuscated class names such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc.
OB: The 'All types' dialog displays obfuscated class names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc. when using JDK 1.4.
EB: The 'All types' dialog should only display standard class names and should not show obfuscated class names when using JDK 1.4.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Launch the application with JDK 1.4.
2. Open the 'All types' dialog.
3. Observe that obfuscated class names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc. are displayed.

Suggested solutions:
a) Sort lower case class names after the ones that start with a capital letter.
b) Filter out obfuscated class names completely.
